alert.note: Alert for Hill County; Northern Blaine County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 4:58PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Scattered strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Blaine and northeastern Hill Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 456 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms across northern Blaine and northeastern Hill Counties. These storms are nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Turner and Hogeland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with thess storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Thess storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
